page.title: 12VISIT TO LOCAL FIRE STATION
page.content: On Wed.11thJune a group of children went to the fire station.When we arrived we went upstairs to an office, where the station officer,Mr Valentine told us some general things about the station and its firemen.We were shown the electronic printer and we were all amazed at the speed of the machine on the touch of a button.There were two fire engines.First we were shown the drivers seat.All engines have to have a radio system.The maximum people the engines could hold was 6 and the minimum 4.Also we were shown the hose pipes,there were two sorts.One was long and very tough and the other was smaller and not so hard.The tough one was used for high water pressure in big fires.At the back of the engines was a tank to store the water for the hosepipes. HELEN COOKE AGED 10
